meanings.definition: A person or thing that drenches.
meanings.sent1: The drenchers in the movie made sure everyone got soaked.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters were the drenchers, putting out the blazing fire.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous drenchers turned on all the sprinklers in the park.
meanings.sent4: The drenchers of laughter filled the room during the comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The drenchers of paint transformed the plain wall into a colorful mural.

meanings.sent1: The sudden drenchers caught everyone without umbrellas off guard.
meanings.sent2: The farmers hoped for drenchers to water their crops during the dry spell.
meanings.sent3: The drenchers outside canceled the picnic, but the kids had an indoor treasure hunt instead.
meanings.sent4: The drenchers of emotion overwhelmed her as she watched the touching movie.
meanings.sent5: The drenchers of confetti at the parade added to the festive atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A device used to administer liquid medication to livestock.
meanings.sent1: The vet used the drenchers to give the cows their medicine.
meanings.sent2: The drenchers helped the farmer easily treat the sick sheep.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat managed to steal the drenchers and play with them in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The drenchers of knowledge flowed into the minds of the eager students.
meanings.sent5: The drenchers of healing potion saved the injured horse's life.
